items.description: Shares of Zomato and Swiggy were sharply lower amid buzz of quick commerce rival Zepto's $250 million secondary sale ahead of IPO, and a cautious note by Macquarie.

items.title: What do leading monsoon indicators suggest for this season?
items.description: Most forecasts indicate a low likelihood of an El Niño phase in the next three to five months, which should be good for the rural economy

items.title: Agri Picks Report March 25, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The National Agricultural Cooperative Marketing Federation procured 864.7 tonnes of mustard as of Thursday, or 0.06% of the total 1.5 million tonnes it aims to buy during the 2024-25 (Jul-Jun) rabi season under the price support scheme.

items.title: Live: Nifty At 2-Month High; Will It Re-test 23,800?| Mark Matthews On Tariff Tantrums| Opening Bell
items.description: The benchmark Nifty 50 jumped more than 1 percent to hit nearly a seven-week high after a gap-up opening on March 24, continuing its northward journey for the sixth consecutive session as bulls remained in strong form with consistent buying interest from FIIs. The index made a good start to the week and is now just 150 points away from its previous swing high of 23,800, which is a crucial zone for further upward movement. If the index decisively surpasses this zone, it can negate the lower highs-lower lows formation and open doors for the 24,000 and 24,200 levels. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at another positive start asnd overnight Wall Street saw a strong rally. Among stocks to watch – RVNL, GRSE, Cement stocks and Suzlon will be in focus. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Ajit Mishra--SVP, Technical Research, Religare Broking and Mark Matthews-- Head of Research, Asia, Julius Baer

items.title: Britannia shares slip as strike in Gujarat plant disrupts operations
items.description: Britannia has stated that it is currently assessing the extent of the strike’s impact while leveraging its available resources to ensure minimal disruption to supply

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex, Nifty erase gains, trade flat; UltraTech Cement, Trent, HDFC Bank top gainers
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Among the sectors, except IT and bank all other sectoral indices are trading in the red. UltraTech Cement, Trent, Bajaj Finserv, HDFC Bank, HCL Technologies are among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers are IndusInd Bank, Dr Reddy's Labs, Hindalco Industries, Shriram Finance, Bajaj Auto. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices down 1 percent each.
